question.qText: What made this sculpture a visible symbol of the legitimacy of mysticism as part of Catholicism?

aBtn.aText: The fact that it was created and still exists.
The fact that the creator was a renowned artist and that it is in a Catholic Church.

question.qText: How is this sculpture indicative of the Baroque style?

aBtn.aText: By the lighting effects and the strong diagonal angles
By the fact that the artist lived during the Baroque period and was Italian

question.qText: Sculptures of the man who commissioned this painting and his family are arranged in theater boxes on either side of Saint Teresa in the chapel. Why?

aBtn.aText: They wanted to be associated with a famous saint.
They wanted to be associated with the chapel they paid for.

question.qText: Is it logical to infer that Bernini had a different attitude towards commissioners than Caravaggio?

aBtn.aText: Yes, because Bernini worked hard to create a beautiful work of art AND to please the commissioner
No, because both were focused only on the work of art
